org.jdesktop.core.animation.rendering

Class Viewport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.core.animation.rendering.Viewport

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class Viewport
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the location of a viewport into a larger image. The viewport may be resized, moved directly, or moved with an animation.

    The size of the image the viewport is into is not allowed to be changed. If the image size changes a new viewport must be constructed.

    Author:
    Tim Halloran

    • Constructor Detail

      • Viewport

        public Viewport(int intoWidth,
                int intoHeight)

    • Method Detail

      • animateHorizontalMovement

        public void animateHorizontalMovement(Viewport.Go toward)
        Starts or stops animated horizontal movement of this viewport. The method sets up the animation and returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        toward - the direction of the animation, either Viewport.Go.LEFT or Viewport.Go.RIGHT. A value of Viewport.Go.STOP stops animated horizontal movement, if any is in progress.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if toward is not one of Viewport.Go.LEFT, Viewport.Go.RIGHT, or Viewport.Go.STOP.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the viewport width is less than one.

      • animateVerticalMovement

        public void animateVerticalMovement(Viewport.Go toward)
        Starts or stops animated vertical movement of this viewport. The method sets up the animation and returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        toward - the direction of the animation, either Viewport.Go.UP or Viewport.Go.DOWN. A value of Viewport.Go.STOP stops animated horizontal movement, if any is in progress.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if toward is not one of Viewport.Go.UP, Viewport.Go.DOWN, or Viewport.Go.STOP.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the viewport height is less than one.

      • setPositionDelta

        public void setPositionDelta(int deltaX,
                             int deltaY)
        Moves the viewport position relative to its current position. If either of the two movements will move the viewport outside the bounds of the image being viewed it is adjusted to stay within the bounds.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - the number of pixels to move the viewport horizontally. A negative value moves the viewport to the left. A positive value moves the viewport to the right. A value of zero leaves the horizontal position of the viewport unchanged.
        deltaY - the number of pixels to move the viewport vertically. A negative value moves the viewport up. A positive value moves the viewport down. A value of zero leaves the vertical position of the viewport unchanged.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if either the viewport width or height is less than one.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets the coordinate of the upper-left of this viewport.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the upper-left of this viewport in pixels.
        y - the Y coordinate of the upper-left of this viewport in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if either the viewport width or height is less than one.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the X coordinate of the upper-left of this viewport.
        Returns:
        the X coordinate of the upper-left of this viewport in pixels.

      • setX

        public void setX(int value)

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the viewport width is less than one.

        public void setHeight(int value)
        Sets the height of this viewport.
        Parameters:
        value - the height of this viewport in pixels.

      • setMovementRate

        public void setMovementRate(long nanosPerPixel)
        Sets the rate of animated viewport movement. A value less than one resets the movement rate to its default value.
        Parameters:
        nanosPerPixel - the rate of animated viewport movement in nanoseconds per pixel or value less than one to reset the movement rate to its default value.

      • setMovementRateSource

        public void setMovementRateSource(Viewport.MovementRateSource source)
        Sets a source for the rate of animated viewport movement. A value of null resets the movement rate to its default value.
        Parameters:
        source - a source for the rate of animated viewport movement or null to reset the movement rate to its default value.

      • getMovementRate

        public long getMovementRate()
        Gets the rate of animated viewport movement.
        Returns:
        the rate of animated viewport movement in nanoseconds per pixel.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes this viewport by ensuring that any running animations are stopped.
